form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Schmitt introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend section 235 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to treat inadmissible aliens more consistently regardless of their country of nationality, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expedited Removal Expansion Act of 2025.
Section 235(b)(1) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1225(b)(1)) is amended—

clause.text: by striking (other than an alien described in subparagraph (F)); and
by striking section 212(a)(6)(C) or 212(a)(7) and inserting paragraph (6) or (7) of section 212(a);
by striking (other than an alien described in subparagraph (F)); and
by striking section 212(a)(6)(C) or 212(a)(7) and inserting paragraph (6) or (7) of section 212(a); and

subparagraph.text: by amending clause (iii) to read as follows:

clause.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security may apply clauses (i) and (ii) to any alien who is inadmissible under paragraph (6) or (7) of section 212(a), without limitation. Such application shall be in the sole and unreviewable discretion of the Secretary and may be modified by the Secretary at any time.

subparagraph.text: by striking Attorney General each place such term appears and inserting Secretary of Homeland Security; and
in clause (v), by striking a significant possibility and inserting clear and convincing evidence;

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking Attorney General and inserting Secretary of Homeland Security;
